sense.def:
One's hands
so deli telesa na spodnjem delu podlahti. Vsak tak del ima po pet prstov.

seg.quote: He took her hand and squeezed it.

sense.def:
The hands of a clock or watch
so ozki kosi kovine ali plastike, ki kažejo, koliko je ura.

To ask someone for a hand with something
pomeni nekoga prositi, naj nam pomaga.

seg.quote: Give me a hand with this desk, will you?

sense.def:
A hand
je oseba, katere naloga je opravljanje napornega telesnega dela.

To hand something to someone
pomeni nekomu nekaj dati.

seg.quote: Could you hand me that piece of wood?
He scribbled four lines and handed the note to the Field Marshal.

sense.def:
Izraz
on the one hand
uporabimo, kadar omenimo en vidik določenih okoliščin. Zatem uporabimo izraz
on the other hand
, ko omenimo njihov drugi, nasprotni vidik.

cit.quote: po eni strani, po drugi strani

seg.quote: John had great difficulties playing cricket. But on the other hand, he was an awfully good rugby player.

sense.def:
Kadar ima nekdo neko odgovornost ali problem
on one's hands
, se mora spoprijeti z njim.

seg.quote: They've still got an economic crisis on their hands.

sense.def:
The job or problem in hand
je delo ali problem, s katerim se trenutno ukvarjamo.

seg.quote: Let's get on with the job in hand.

sense.def:
To have some time in hand
pomeni imeti nekaj prostega časa.

seg.quote: He arrived with half an hour in hand and went for a walk.

sense.def:
Kadar je nekdo
on hand
, je v bližini in pripravljen pomagati.

To have something to hand
pomeni imeti nekaj pripravljenega za morebitno uporabo.

seg.quote: ...using the material most readily to hand.

sense.def:
Kadar je nekaj
at hand
ali
close at hand
, je časovno ali krajevno zelo blizu.

seg.quote: I picked up a book that happened to lie at hand.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj naredimo
by hand
, naredimo z rokami in ne s strojem.

Kadar sta dve osebi
hand in hand
, se držita za roke.

Kadar dve stvari
go hand in hand
, sta tesno povezani.

cit.quote: v tesni povezavi, z roko v roki

seg.quote: Military superiority went hand in hand with organizational superiority.

sense.def:
Kadar neki kraj poznamo
like the back of one's hand
, ga poznamo izjemno dobro.

To try one's hand at a new activity
pomeni poskusiti opravljati neko novo dejavnost.

seg.quote: I had tried my hand at milking years ago.

sense.def:
To have a hand in a situation
pomeni biti dejavno udeležen pri nečem.

seg.quote: I had a hand in drafting the appeal.

sense.def:
To take someone in hand
pomeni prevzeti nadzor nad nekom.

To give a free hand to someone
pomeni nekomu dovoliti, da opravi določeno nalogo natanko tako, kot želi.

Kadar neko zamisel zavrnemo
out of hand
, to storimo takoj in popolnoma.

Kadar neka oseba ali okoliščine
get out of hand
, jih nismo več sposobni obvladovati.

cit.quote: uiti iz rok, uiti izpod nadzora

sense.def:
Kadar neka lastnina
changes hands
, je prodana ali podarjena.

cit.quote: priti v druge roke, menjati lastnika

sense.def:
To wash one's hands of someone or something
pomeni zavrniti, da bi še naprej prevzemali odgovornost za nekoga ali nekaj.

To hand something down
ali
to hand something on
pomeni nekaj izročiti ljudem mlajše generacije.

seg.quote: Such knowledge was handed down from father to son.
Property is something handed on from generation to generation.

sense.def:
To hand in a written paper
pomeni izročiti zapis odgovorni osebi.

seg.quote: I haven't yet marked the work you handed in.
I was tempted to hand in my resignation at once.

sense.def:
To hand something out
pomeni nekaj izročiti ljudem.

seg.quote: Hand out the books.
Family doctors handed out information on treatment.

sense.def:
To hand something over to someone
pomeni nekomu nekaj dati.

seg.quote: Samuel was clearly about to hand over large sums of money to this man.

sense.def:
To hand over to someone
pomeni nekoga narediti odgovornega za nekaj, za kar smo bili prej odgovorni sami.

seg.quote: Sir John handed over to his deputy and left.
